result.execSummary:
The defendant James J Nitek Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

timeConds.notes: Has credit for seven days served

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant James J Nitek in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM100, 15CM153.  Court will order sentence withheld, one year probation, AODA assessment, 7 days jails, credit for 7days, CC/DNA surcharge.
Sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Order for Compass Assessment.  Copies to DA, Atty Barna and the Jail and DE.
Sentencing hearing on June 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James J Nitek in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM100, 15CM153.  Agreement has been reached in all cases.  

15CM99-DE will enter a plea of NC.

15CM100-21

15CM153-Ct's 1, 2 will be DRI.  DE will enter a plea to Ct 3 of NC.  Court will accept both and find the DE guilty.  
State asks for two years of probation.  Atty Barna argues against probation. 

Court will order a compass assessment by prepared.  Will set for sentencing after completion.  
Attorney wishes to address the issue of bond restictions. Court will modify the bond allowing DE access to the campground.  He cannot go into the bar, nor consume alcohol.  Court will lift the no contact provision with Jacquie Nitek.  Set for sentencing 6-7-16 @ 10:00AM.

Defendant James J Nitek in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM100, 15CM153.  The court will hear motions at 8:00AM before JT.  15CM100 will be the #1 JT on 2-26-16.  15CM99 will be #2 JT.
State's Witness List and Prosposed Exhibits  (Filed in 15CM100)

Defendant James J Nitek in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM100, 15CM153.  No agreement has been reached at this time, Atty asking for JT date.  Set for #1 JT, 2-26-16 15CM99,  15CM100 #2, 15CM153 #3.  3-04-16 #1 JT-15CM100, #2-15CM153, #1 JT 15CM153, 4-01-16.   Final PTC, 1-26-16 @ 3:00PM for all cases.

Defendant James J Nitek in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM100, 15CM153.  Atty asking for adjournment to allow for negotiations.  Set for RH  1-05-16 @ 10:00AM.

Defendant James J Nitek in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM100,15CM153.  INIT APP-15CM153-  Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  Atty wishes to revisit the issue of bond.  Atty wishes that her client may have contact with the campground.  The state opposes any modifications.  The court will deny any modifications at this time.  Set for RH 11-17-15 @ 2:00PM.

Defendant James J Nitek in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM100.    Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  Bond continues.  Set for RH 10-06-15 @ 1:00PM.

The court will lift the no contact with Jackie Nitek, but all contact will be verbally and physically abuse free.  DE cannot go into the tavern on the campground, but can work at the campground.  Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.

Defendant James J Nitek in court with attorney Annette M Barna appearing telephonic.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM99.  Atty would like to address the issue of no contact on the bond.  Atty states victim has completed the TO Shelter program.  The court will lift the no contact, but all contact will be verbally and physically abuse free.  DE cannot go into the tavern on the campground, but can work at the campground.  Set for 8-11-15 @ 2:00PM.  No alcohol provisions will remain on the bonds.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.  No contact with Jackie Nitek of any kind.  DE cannot go to the campground.

Defendant James J Nitek in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Defendant James J Nitek in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  Atty wishes to revisit the issue of bond.  State believes cash bond is necessary.  The court will release on a $1000.00 sign bond, NO CONTACT OF ANY KIND WITH JACKIE NITEK,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.  DE cannot go to the campground.   RH 7-28-15 @ 11:00AM
No contact with Jackie  Nitek.  Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.
